required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Toripalimab and Anlotinib Combination Treatment in Patients With Recurrent or Metastatic Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma After Failure of at Least One Line of Platinum-Based Chemotherapy (TORAL)
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label, Phase Ⅱ Study of Toripalimab and Anlotinib Combination Treatment in Patients With Recurrent or Metastatic Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma After Failure of at Least One Line of Platinum-Based Chemotherapy (TORAL)

brief_summary.textblock: This phase 2 trial studies toripalimab and anlotinib combination treatment in patients with recurrent or metastatic nasopharyngeal carcinoma after failure of at least one line of platinum-based chemotherapy

primary_outcome.description: Objective Response rate will be determined on the basis of investigator assessments
the proportion of patients who had a best response rating of complete response, partial response, or stable disease will be determined on the basis of investigator assessments

secondary_outcome.description: The time from the start of treatment to the progression of the tumor or death (due to any cause).
The time from the start of treatment to time of death (due to any cause).
Complete Response rate will be determined on the basis of investigator assessments
Partial Response rate will be determined on the basis of investigator assessments
The time from the first assessment of complete remission or partial remission to progressive disease or death (due to any cause).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse Events will be determined and graded on the basis of investigator assessments according to NCI CTC AE 5.0

arm_group.description: Patients receive toripalimab at a dose of 240 mg on day 1 and anlotinib at a dose of 12 mg before breakfast for once-daily on days 1-14. Treatment cycles repeat every 21 days in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity

intervention.description: Toripalimab 240 mg iv.drip d1; Anlotinib 12mg po qd d1-14.
